Name: ABRASIVE
Description:
Removing unwanted tissue or foreign materials from various body surfaces, including
mechanical tooth cleaning and/or gloss improvement.

Name: ABSORBENT
Description: Taking up water- and/or oil-soluble (dissolved or finely dispersed) substances.

Name: ADHESIVE
Description: Tending to unite/bind/bond surfaces together.

Name: ANTI-SEBORRHEIC
Description:
Preventing or relieving the symptoms of seborrhea and/or seborrheic dermatitis, including
dandruff.

Name: ANTI-SEBUM
Description: Helping control sebum production.

Name: ANTICAKING
Description:
Preventing agglomeration of particulate solids into lumps or hard masses (cohesive cake), thus
allowing free flow of particles.

Name: ANTICORROSIVE
Description: Preventing and or inhibiting the corrosion of the packaging material.

Name: ANTIFOAMING
Description:
Suppressing foam during manufacturing or reducing the tendency of finished products to
generate foam.

Name: ANTIMICROBIAL
Description: Preventing and/or slowing down microbial growth.

Name: ANTIOXIDANT
Description: Inhibiting reactions promoted by oxygen, thus avoiding oxidation and rancidity.

Name: ANTIPERSPIRANT
Description: Reducing perspiration.

Name: ANTIPLAQUE
Description: Helping protect against plaque.

Name: ANTISTATIC
Description: Preventing and/or reducing static electricity by neutralising electrical charge on surfaces.

Name: ASTRINGENT
Description: Contracting and/or tightening the skin.

Name: BINDING
Description: Providing adhesive properties during and after compression in cosmetic tablets and/or cakes.

Name: BLEACHING
Description: Bleaching or lightening the shade of hair and/or skin.

Name: BUFFERING
Description:
Stabilising the pH of an aqueous medium in a narrow range even if an acid or base is added.
Altering and/or maintaining a cosmetic product's pH at the desired level.

Name: BULKING
Description:
Non-reactive (chemically inert), solid ingredients that dilute other solids and/or increase the
volume of cosmetic products.

Name: CHELATING
Description:
Forming complexes with metal ions which could affect the stability and/or appearance of
cosmetics.

Name: CLEANSING
Description: Helping to keep the body surface clean.

Name: COLORANT
Description:
Exclusively or mainly intended to colour the cosmetic product, the body as a whole or certain
parts thereof, by absorption or reflection of visible light; (precursors of oxidative hair colorants
shall be deemed colorants). All authorised colorants are substances in the positive list of Annex
IV to the Cosmetics Regulation 1223/2009.

Name: DENATURANT
Description:
Rendering cosmetics unpalatable. Mostly added to cosmetics containing ethyl alcohol to make it
unsuitable for ingestion.

Name: DEPILATORY
Description:
Breaking down the the mechanical strength of hair fibers so that they can be removed by mild
scraping/rubbing.

Name: DETANGLING
Description:
Reducing or eliminating hair intertwining due to hair surface alteration or damage and, thus,
helping combing.

Name: DISPERSING NON-SURFACTANT
Description:
Facilitating the dispersion of solids in liquids. They function primarily by coating the solid
through the process of adsorption, thus changing the surface characteristic of the suspended
solid.

Name: EMULSION STABILISING
Description: Helping the process of emulsification and improving emulsion stability and shelf-life.

Name: EPILATING
Description:
Applied to the skin, and stripped off quickly to remove hair. With epilation the entire hair is
removed from the follicle, whereas with depilation the hair is removed only to the surface of the
skin.

Name: EXFOLIATING
Description: Initiating and/or accelerating removal of the layers of dead skin cells from the skin surface.

Name: EYELASH CONDITIONING
Description:
Conditioning and enhancing the appearance of eyelashes. Improving the gloss or sheen of
eyelashes, coating the eyelash hair to increase the appearance of its diameter and length, or
helping with the separation of the eyelash hair.

Name: FILM FORMING
Description: Producing (upon application) a continuous film on the skin, hair or nails.

Name: FLAVOURING
Description: Imparting taste and/or flavour to a cosmetic product.

Name: FOAMING
Description:
Traping numerous small bubbles of air or other gas within a small volume of liquid by modifying
the surface tension of the liquid.

Name: FRAGRANCE
Description: Imparting an odour or taste. Creating a perceivable pleasant smell and/or masking a bad smell.

Name: GEL FORMING
Description:
Giving the consistency of a gel (a semi-solid preparation with some elasticity) to a liquid
preparation.

Name: HAIR CONDITIONING
Description:
Enhancing the appearance and feel of hair. Leaving the hair easy to comb, supple, soft and shiny
and/or imparting volume, lightness, gloss, texture, etc.

Name: HAIR DYEING
Description:
Imparting color to hair. Hair dyeing preparations may be temporary, semi-permanent,
permanent, depending on the length of time the colorant remains on the hair.

Name: HAIR FIXING
Description: Permitting physical control of hair style.

Name: HAIR WAVING OR STRAIGHTENING
Description:
Modifying the chemical structure of the hair, allowing it to be set in the style required
(permanent waves or hair straightening).

Name: HUMECTANT
Description: Retaining and/or preserving the moisture in a product during use.

Name: KERATOLYTIC
Description: Helping to eliminate the dead cells of the stratum corneum.

Name: LIGHT STABILIZER
Description: Protecting the cosmetic product from deterioration effects of light.

Name: LYTIC
Description:
Helping to break down lipids, proteins, and polysaccharides into smaller components, usually by
the action of enzymes.

Name: MOISTURISING
Description: Increasing the water content of the skin and keeping it soft and smooth.

Name: NAIL CONDITIONING
Description:
Improving and/or enhancing the cosmetic characteristics of the nail (moisturizing, increasing
sheen, reducing brittleness and flaking, etc.).

Name: NAIL SCULPTING
Description: Forming a hard structure that resembles the nail plate.

Name: NOT REPORTED
Description: No function currently reported

Name: OPACIFYING
Description: Reducing transparency or translucency of cosmetics.

Name: ORAL CARE
Description: Providing cosmetic effects to the oral cavity, e.g. cleansing, deodorising, protecting.

Name: OXIDISING
Description: Changing the chemical nature of another ingredient by adding oxygen (or removing hydrogen).

Name: PEARLESCENT
Description: Imparting a nacreous appearance to cosmetics.

Name: PERFUMING
Description: Used for perfume and aromatic raw materials.

Name: pH ADJUSTERS
Description: Controlling the pH of cosmetic products.

Name: PLASTICISER
Description:
Softening and making supple synthetic polumers that otherwise could not be easily deformed,
spread or worked out.

Name: PRESERVATIVE
Description:
Exclusively or mainly intended to inhibit the development of micro-organisms in the cosmetic
product. All authorised preservatives are substances in the positive list of Annex V to the
Cosmetics Regulation 1223/2009.

Name: PROPELLANT
Description:
Generating pressure in an aerosol pack, expelling contents when the valve is opened. Some
liquefied propellants can act as solvents.

Name: REDUCING
Description: Changing the chemical nature of another ingredient by adding hydrogen (or removing oxygen).

Name: REFATTING
Description: Replenishing the lipids of the hair or of the top layers of the skin.

Name: REFRESHING
Description: Imparting a pleasant freshness to the skin.

Name: SKIN CONDITIONING
Description: Maintaining the skin in good condition.

Name: SKIN CONDITIONING - EMOLLIENT
Description: Acting as lubricants on the skin surface providing the skin with a soft and smooth appearance.

Name: SKIN CONDITIONING - HUMECTANT
Description:
Increasing the water content of the top layers of the skin. Humectants are primarily hygroscopic
agents drawing moisture from the surrounding air.

Name: SKIN CONDITIONING - MISCELLANEOUS
Description:
Enhancing the appearance of dry and/or damaged skin by reducing flaking and restoring
suppleness.

Name: SKIN CONDITIONING - OCCLUSIVE
Description:
Retarding the evaporation of water from the skin surface. Occlusives are generally lipids which
tend to remain on the skin surface and thus increase the water content of skin.

Name: SKIN PROTECTING
Description: Helping to avoid harmful effects to the skin from external factors.

Name: SLIP MODIFIER
Description: Enhancing the flow properties of other ingredients without reacting chemically with them.

Name: SMOOTHING
Description: Seeking to achieve an even skin surface by decreasing roughness or irregularities.

Name: SOLVENT
Description:
Dissolving other components of cosmetics. Solvents are usually liquids (aqueous and
nonaqueous).

Name: SOOTHING
Description: Lightening discomfort of the skin or of the scalp.

Name: SURFACE MODIFIER
Description:
Applied to other cosmetic components to make them more hydrophilic or hydrophobic, or to
modify their physical/chemical properties (in some cases, surface modifiers may form a covalent
bond with substrates).

Name: SURFACTANT - CLEANSING
Description:
Wetting body surfaces, emulsifying or solubilizing oils, and suspending soil (generally, such
ingredients contribute to the foaming and lathering properties of cleansing products).

Name: SURFACTANT - DISPERSING
Description: Helping distribute an insoluble solid in a liquid phase.

Name: SURFACTANT - EMULSIFYING
Description:
Helping suspensions or dispersions of liquids in a second liquid by reducing the surface tension
of the substances to be emulsified.

Name: SURFACTANT - FOAM BOOSTING
Description: Increasing foaming capacity and/or stabilize foams in general.

Name: SURFACTANT - HYDROTROPE
Description: Enhancing the water solubility of another surfactant.

Name: SURFACTANT - SOLUBILIZING
Description: Helping another component (solute) to dissolve in a medium in which it is not normally soluble.

Name: TANNING
Description: Darkening the skin with or without exposure to UV.

Name: TONIC
Description: Producing a feeling of well-being on skin and hair.

Name: UV ABSORBER
Description: Protecting the cosmetic product from the effects of UV-light.

Name: UV FILTER
Description:
Exclusively or mainly intended to protect the skin and/or hair against certain UV radiation by
absorbing, reflecting or scattering UV radiation. All authorised UV filters are substances in the
positive list of Annex VI to the Cosmetics Regulation 1223/2009.

Name: VISCOSITY CONTROLLING
Description: Increasing or decreasing the viscosity (thickness) of cosmetics.
